page.title: 12Derivations
page.content: Myton-on-Swale The name Myton which in the past has been spelt Mitane, Milton & Miton is derived from two saxon words meaning a lake or pool and a town. Tholthorpe Originally believed to be the 'village'(Thorpe) of Thurulf a Norseman but in the Domesday book prefixed Thorald and belonging to the Soke of Helperby was later Thol, 'a resting place'. Drovers on their journey to York from the North, watering and resting their cattle here. Ten Mile Hill, to the west of the village, the source of numerous human bones and stoneage tools, is believed to have been the scene of some terrible battle upon which history is silent.
